result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis Thomas Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Upon, revocation the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay a fine of $600.00 plus all applicable costs, fees and surcharges from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT. Any remaining bail to be held pending restitution hearing.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statues section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession; Voting.

TERMS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with the Department.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
- Seek/maintain full time employment.
- No driving without valid driver's license.
- Cooperate with any other treatment deemed necessary.

timeConds.notes:
Good Time to apply; Huber for work and treatment conditional upon absolute sobriety.
****ORDER;  Defendant's request for privileges is granted..defendant may be released for WORK & Work Search) and SCHOOL (MATC) October 25, 2014/Judge William Pocan)****

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Louis Thomas not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Louis Thomas in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's pro se request for medical release and release for church on Sundays received in cases 14CF001122 and 13CT1904.  Filed in 14CF1122.

Defendant Louis Thomas in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Statements made as to sentencing.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS,  with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years.  This sentence is stayed and defendant placed on PROABTION for a period of 30 months.  Upon revocation, the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of probation and extended supervision:
-Condition of probation serve 7 months in the house of correction-good time to apply; Huber for work and treatment conditional upon absolute sobriety.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Seek and maintain full time employment
-No driving without valid drivers license
-Cooperate with any other treatment deemed necessary.
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge from bail on deposit.
The Court ordered defendant pay a fine of $600.00 plus all applicable costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit.  Any remaining bail to be held pending restitution hearing.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting
